comments:
This works for me using the steps described (I get the expected blank shell with the title text 'here I am')

Maybe something is wrong with the swt libraries you added to the build path?
Are you sure you imported as SOURCE?
yes, I have 2 projects for swt in my workspace full of swt source files

when we are launching (a java app), we don't care about other project source in the workspace unless the projects are dependent, so the only version of swt we will be using in the launch is the one that you added to the buildpath.

A way you can test which swt it is trying to use is to debug your example app and do a 'step into' on the constructor for Display, you should see that it will open a .class file (the one from the jar on the build path), not a .java file
Mmmh - now I can also not reproduce. No idea what was different this morning.

traces.message: no swt-win32-3408 or swt-win32 in swt.library.path, java.library.path or the jar file
